message_list.content: Hola, bienvenido a Celestar Air. Soy Nova, tu asistente virtual de vuelo. ¿En qué puedo ayudarte hoy?
Hi, I'd like to book a multi-city trip, please.

Great—let’s get your multi-city trip set up. Could you share each leg with origin, destination, and date? For example: Leg 1: New York to London on May 14; Leg 2: London to Dubai on May 18; Leg 3: Dubai to New York on May 25. Also, which cabin would you like: Economy, Premium Economy, or Aether Business?

Sure, Leg 1: Washington Dulles to New York JFK on December 16, midday; Leg 2: New York JFK to Washington Dulles on December 20, between 1 PM and 5 PM; Leg 3: Washington Dulles to London Heathrow on December 22, evening. I’d like Economy cabin, please.

Thanks! Let me search those Economy options. This may take a moment; thanks for your patience.

Here are the top options:
- Leg 1 (Dec 16, IAD → JFK, midday): CE214, 12:10–13:33, 1h23m, nonstop; CE228, 13:05–14:32, 1h27m, nonstop; CE244, 11:45–13:12, 1h27m, nonstop.
- Leg 2 (Dec 20, JFK → IAD, 1–5 PM): CE317, 13:20–14:49, 1h29m, nonstop; CE329, 15:10–16:37, 1h27m, nonstop; CE341, 16:05–17:36, 1h31m, nonstop.
- Leg 3 (Dec 22, IAD → LHR, evening): CE90, 19:10–07:45+1, 7h35m, nonstop; CE94, 21:00–09:35+1, 7h35m, nonstop; CE102, 22:15–10:55+1, 7h40m, nonstop.

Please confirm one flight per leg and I’ll hold them while we continue. If any times need adjusting, tell me your preference.
For Leg 1, I'll take CE214 at 12:10. For Leg 2, I'll go with CE317 at 13:20. And for Leg 3, I'll choose CE90 at 19:10.

Perfect—CE214 (IAD→JFK 12:10–13:33), CE317 (JFK→IAD 13:20–14:49), and CE90 (IAD→LHR 19:10–07:45+1) are selected. I’ve placed a temporary hold on these seats for about 15 minutes while we complete the details.

To issue the tickets, I’ll need passenger information in one go. Please provide:
- First name and last name (English characters)
- Gender
- Date of birth
- Nationality
- Passport number and expiration date (for the London leg)
- Known Traveler Number or Redress (optional)

I’ll read back a combined confirmation once I have these.
Alex Miller, male, March 5, 1985, American nationality. I don’t have my passport details with me right now, but I can provide them later. I don’t have a Known Traveler Number or Redress either.

Thanks, Alex Miller. I have:
- Name: Alex Miller
- Gender: Male
- DOB: March 5, 1985
- Nationality: American
- KTN/Redress: None

For the London leg, I’ll need your passport number and expiration date before ticketing. Would you like to proceed with the domestic segments now and add the London passport details later, or wait and complete all tickets together once you have the passport?

Also, please share your contact details:
- Email (English characters)
- Country code and phone number
And let me know your preferred notifications: email, SMS, or both.

My email is alex.miller@mail.com and my phone number is +1 0719081642. Please send notifications to both email and SMS. Let’s proceed with the domestic segments now, and I’ll provide the passport details for the London leg later.

Great—domestic segments will be ticketed now, and we’ll add the London leg once your passport details are provided.

Contact preferences set to email and SMS. Before payment, here’s your itinerary:
- Dec 16: IAD → JFK, CE214, 12:10–13:33, Economy
- Dec 20: JFK → IAD, CE317, 13:20–14:49, Economy

Shall I proceed to payment for these two flights now?
Yes, please proceed with the payment for the domestic flights.
Great, I’ll take care of the payment now. Which payment method would you like to use—credit/debit card, mobile wallet, or a voucher/credit? And what billing country is the card registered to?
Credit card, registered in the United States.
Perfect—I'll process a U.S.-issued credit card. Please enter your card number, expiration date, and CVC now, and I’ll confirm once the payment is successful.
I don’t feel comfortable sharing my card details over the phone. Can I pay online instead?

Absolutely—you can pay online. I’ve generated a secure payment link for your two domestic flights. I’ve sent it to alex.miller@mail.com and via SMS to +1 0719081642. Please open the link to complete payment within 15 minutes to keep your hold active. This may take a moment to reflect; I’ll monitor for confirmation and update you once it’s successful.

Would you like me to also pencil in a reminder to add your passport details for the London leg, or will you reach out when you have them?
I’ll reach out when I have the passport details, thanks.

Sounds good. I’ll keep the London leg on hold until we hear from you, and we’ll finalize it once you share your passport number and expiration date. In the meantime, your domestic payment link remains active for 15 minutes—let me know once you’ve completed it, and I’ll issue the tickets right away.

Is there anything else I can help you with today?
